author: Cameron Mulder
comment: I can't get this working with my moto 360.  No matter how hard I am working out it never reads a heart rate over 70.  Otherwise the design is good, and I like how it should work.  Hopefully it gets fixed, would love for something like this to work.
title: Doesn't appear to work with Moto 360

author: Brandon Vazquez
comment: Why can't i just start a workout and it records my heart rate as I workout? I do not want to set the time limit.   Will rate higher if this feature is added.
title: Needs more

author: Tomas Gutierrez
comment: The app is not as usable as I expected. It has these features that I have use from one time use, which lead me my disappointment. I used LG R  1. Constant heart rate monitor (This will drain your battery around 30%/hr) 2. The Heart rate is totally just for display/monitoring. It would be best if it gets logged to Google fit so at least you would know your statistics on the workout. Since you wont really read the display constanly while doing something. By normal use you usually just go back to the data after doing the activity.  3. Create your workout. This part is confusing when you create initially. And don't make a mistake creating it since you cannot edit. The only way to do it is to delete the workout and start again. Big time sucks!  If not mistaken some of this disappointments comes from the watch build itself. Most times it will read inaccurate. I have been wearing a garmin watch with chest HR strap before and that one was pretty accurate. But this one I know my HR is around 140 but its reading 70. I believe the sweat and movements from the workout gets an inaccurate reading.  Given all of this,  - Not usable on real world scenario.  - I would like a refund!
title: Too early

author: Gonçalo Silva
comment: Great little app. Developers are super responsive. Highly recommended!
title: Fantastic app

author: Michael Smith
comment: App installed on my phone but never ran.
title: Didn't work with Moto 360
